question: Why man cannot digest cellulose whereas cows can do so?
option1: Their gut contains certain bacteria capable of digesting cellulose
option4: They produce enzyme cellulose which can digest cellulose
answer: Their gut contains certain bacteria capable of digesting cellulose
explanation: Unlike cows for example don\'t have the necessary bacteria in their intestines that make the enzymes necessary to breakdown the 1-4 beta glucose bonds. So we cannot break down cellulose into its constituent glucose molecules as we do with starch.
